intro: Boerhavia lateriflora, commonly known as the lateriflora bluet, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branched stems and small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has alternate, ovate to lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient species within the Nyctaginaceae family.
